verses.text: 神的約耶和華有話臨到耶利米，說：

words.note: Reverence space omitted; refers to the one God.

verses.text: 「你要告訴猶大人和耶路撒冷的居民：『你們要聽從這約的話。』
你要對他們說：『耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：不聽從這約的話的，必受咒詛。

words.note: Reverence space omitted; refers to the one God.
Marks the preceding phrase as a nominalized clause.

verses.text: 這約就是我把你們的列祖從埃及地、從鐵爐那裡領出來的那天所吩咐他們的，說：你們要聽從我的話，照著我吩咐你們的一切話去行；這樣，你們就作我的子民，我也作你們的 神。

words.note: Modifies the following noun or nominalized phrase.
Forms a nominalized clause, often for passive meaning.
Marks the preceding phrase as a nominalized clause.
Reverence space omitted; refers to the one God.

verses.text: 我好履行向你們列祖所起的誓，就是把流奶與蜜之地賜給他們，好像今天一樣。』」於是我回答說：「耶和華啊！阿們。」

words.note: Forms a nominalized clause, often for passive meaning.
Here means 'make' as in 'make an oath'.
Modifies the following noun.

words.pinyin: liú nǎi yǔ mì zhī dì
words.definition: land flowing with milk and honey

words.note: Loanword from Hebrew, meaning 'so be it'.

verses.text: ，必受懲罰耶和華又對我說：「你要在猶大各城中和耶路撒冷的街道上，宣告這一切話，說：『你們要聽從、遵行這約的話。

words.note: Post-position for location/scope
Post-position for location

verses.text: 因為自從我領你們的列祖出埃及地那一天，我已鄭重警告他們，直到今日，我仍不斷警告他們，說：「你們要聽從我的話。」

words.note: More formal than 今天 (jīntiān)

verses.text: 他們卻不聽從，毫不留心，各人隨從自己頑梗的惡心行事。所以，我使這約中一切咒詛的話臨到他們身上。我曾吩咐他們遵行這約，他們卻不遵行。』」

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for spiritual stubbornness
Distinct from ěxīn (nausea)
Implies 'upon their persons' or 'upon them'

verses.text: 耶和華又對我說：「在猶大人和耶路撒冷的居民中間，有背叛的陰謀。
他們回到他們祖先所犯的罪孽中。他們的祖先不肯聽從我的話，卻隨從事奉別的神。以色列家和猶大家都違犯了我和他們列祖所立的約。」

words.note: Indicates a passive or nominalized action
Commonly used for religious service or worship

verses.text: 因此耶和華這樣說：「看哪！我必使災禍臨到他們身上，是他們不能逃脫的；他們雖然向我哀求，我必不聽他們。

words.note: An interjection to draw attention.
Indicates strong determination or certainty.
Here functions as a locative phrase indicating 'upon them'.
Often used in religious contexts for earnest entreaty.
Indicates strong determination or certainty.

verses.text: 那時，猶大各城的人和耶路撒冷的居民，都必去哀求他們燒香供奉的神，只是在他們遭難的時候，這些神卻完全不能拯救他們。

words.note: Indicates strong determination or certainty.
Often used in religious contexts for earnest entreaty.
Refers to pagan deities here.
Refers to pagan deities here.
Indicates a turn or contrast in thought.

verses.text: 猶大啊！你的城有多少，你的神也有多少；耶路撒冷的街道有多少，你為那可恥的巴力所設立燒香的祭壇也有多少。

words.note: Indicates exclamation or emotion.
Refers to pagan deities here.
Refers to a Canaanite deity.
Here, it indicates the agent of the action '設立' (set up).

verses.text: 「至於你，不要為這人民祈禱，不要為他們呼求禱告，因為他們遭難向我呼求的時候，我必不聽他們。

words.note: Indicates strong determination or certainty.

verses.text: 「我所愛的既然行了罪大惡極的事，還有甚麼資格在我的殿裡呢？難道祭肉可以消除你的災禍，使你得著歡樂嗎？」

words.note: Used to form a nominal phrase 'that which is V-ed by S'.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase (the loved one).
An idiom describing extreme wickedness.
Refers to a grand hall or temple, often God's dwelling.
Often used as a locative suffix (e.g., 殿裡 = inside the temple).
Used to form rhetorical questions or suggest obviousness.
Used to introduce a rhetorical question implying doubt or disbelief.
A resultative verb indicating successful attainment.
Used at the end of a declarative sentence to turn it into a question.

verses.text: 耶和華曾稱你的名字為壯麗、多結美果的青橄欖樹；現在他必藉風暴雷轟，把它燃點起來，它的枝子也都折斷。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for good deeds or spiritual produce.
The olive tree is a symbol of prosperity and blessing in the Bible.

verses.text: 那栽種你的萬軍之耶和華，已經宣布降災攻擊你，是因以色列家和猶大家自己所行的惡；他們向巴力燒香，惹我發怒。

words.note: A title for God emphasizing His power and command over armies.
A Canaanite deity worshipped by the ancient Israelites.
A ritual act often associated with worship of deities.

verses.text: 耶和華把他們的陰謀指示我，我就知道了；那時，你把他們所行的給我指明。
verses.heading: A Plot Against Jeremiah is Revealed and He Complains of Injustice

verses.text: 至於我，我卻像一隻馴良的羊羔，被牽到屠宰之地；我並不知道他們設計謀害我。他們說：「我們來把這樹和果子（「果子」原文作「它的食物」）都毀滅吧，把它從活人之地剪除，使它的名不再被人記念。」

words.note: Used to emphasize a negative statement.

verses.text: 但萬軍之耶和華啊！你是憑公義審判人，試驗人肺腑和心腸的。求你讓我看見你在他們身上施行的報復，因為我已經把我的案件向你陳明了。

words.note: A title for God emphasizing His power and command over armies.
A core theological concept in the Bible.
Often used metaphorically for one's innermost thoughts and emotions.
Refers to one's moral character, intentions, and compassion.

verses.text: 因此耶和華指責那些亞拿突人，他們尋索你命，向你恐嚇說：「不要奉耶和華的名說預言，免得你死在我們手中。」

words.note: Often means 'seek out with ill intent' in biblical contexts.

words.definition: in the name of, by order
words.note: Formal or biblical usage for 'acting on behalf of'.
Can be a noun (prophecy) or a verb (prophesy).
Literally 'in hand', meaning 'under one's control'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「看哪！我要懲罰他們；他們的年輕人必死在刀下，他們的兒女必因饑荒而死。

words.note: Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts'.
Classical particle, similar to '的'.
An exclamation to draw attention.
Refers to death by execution or battle.
More common in literary or historical contexts now.

verses.text: 他們中間必沒有餘剩的，因為在懲罰他們的年日，我必使災禍臨到他們身上。」

words.definition: not have, there will not be

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for 'what remains'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, e.g., 'the remaining ones'.
Literary or biblical term for a period of time.
Often used for events happening to people.
Refers to something happening to or affecting a person directly.
